alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 14 at 9:29PM PDT until March 14 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...All of Orange County and the Inland Empire. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A Pacific storm system with moisture from an Atmospheric River will spread widespread moderate to heavy rainfall across the area. This rain falling on already saturated soils will likely produce rapid runoff, resulting in local flooding. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire
